We still have tickets to our screening of "Jane: An Abortion Service." Will you be there?
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Join us for a robust afternoon discussion about how we can fight for and protect reproductive freedom in Georgia and about life before Roe.

The ACLU of Georgia is proudly co-sponsoring a special screening of the award-winning documentary "Jane: An Abortion Service." The film details the underground Chicago-based women's group that performed nearly 12,000 safe, illegal abortions before the U.S. Supreme Court handed down its groundbreaking decision in Roe v Wade.

Jane: An Abortion Service

Join us for a special screening that gives us insight into life before Roe — the unfathomable choices women had to make, and the bravery of women who supported one another.

Sunday, September 8, 3 p.m.
Plaza Theatre
1049 Ponce De Leon Ave NE
Atlanta, GA 30306

RSVP TODAY

After, we will embark on a discussion with Jane's founder, Heather Booth, a civil rights activist, feminist, and political strategist. Additionally, we'll hear from local Georgia leaders including ACLU of Georgia, Planned Parenthood Southeast Advocates, NAPAWF, NARAL Pro-Choice Georgia, and ARC Southeast.

We hope to see you and your friends on Sunday, September 8!

Andrea Young
Executive Director, ACLU of Georgia
